moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3 g6: against stronger players, I sometimes consider d6: b5 and d5 are weak spots, at this point; but most of them, have no clue...
moves.3. Nf3 Bg7 4. d4 cxd4 5. Nxd4 e6: d5 taken care of: b5 is not penetrable, due to a7-a6; for now...
moves.7. Bf4 O-O 8. e5: d5 is prohibited for now: but we have other options...
moves.8... a6 9. Bd3 b5 10. a4 Nbc6 11. Be2 d5: now, after exd6ep, we can capture Nd4...
moves.17... Qxc3 18. fxe5 Bxe5 19. Ra2 Bxd4 20: the smoke is clearing: Black has conquered the center...
moves.27. Rfa1 Bf5: at this point, better than f7-f5: we need to connect the Rooks...
moves.28. Ba5 Rd7 29. Bxf5 Nxf5: Black has created two free pawns...
moves.30. Rd1: Re1, would have been better: but White wants to avoid d4-d3...
moves.36. Be3: White needs to make room for an escaping King...
moves.38. Rxd3: with this, White resigned: he will lose everything...
